<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/easyjet-begin-offsetting-fuel-emissions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
EasyJet Offers a Mini Green New Deal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="green plane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTk4MjM5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">EasyJet, a British budget airline, said yesterday it will immediately start <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/nov/19/easyjet-offset-carbon-emissions-flights-thomas-cook-collapse?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offsetting</a> fuel emissions from its routes, becoming the world’s first major airline to operate net-zero carbon flights. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The aviation industry is confronting its impact on climate change—not because the last book club pick was Naomi Klein, but because some travelers are opting for literal torture (<a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-49890057?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">24-hour train rides</a>) over flying.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those people have been overcome with <em>flygskam</em>, a Swedish term that means “flight shame.” Citi <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/citi-flight-shaming-getting-traction-could-cost-airlines-billions.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defines</a> flight shame as “the inherent guilt that an individual feels as a result of one’s aviation-related carbon footprint.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Flygskam is a widespread condition. </strong></span><span>A UBS survey of Western travelers found that 21% of respondents reduced the number of flights they took in the last year out of concern for the climate. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Aviation </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/8646ab32-c289-11e9-a8e9-296ca66511c9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contributes</a></span><span> close to 5% of human-caused warming, reports the FT.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But will offsets help flygskam be flygsgone? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bravo on that transition to the growing market for carbon offsets, a process by which polluters (like EasyJet) fund projects that reduce carbon emissions to “offset” their own. Those projects can include planting a whole lot of trees or spearheading renewable energy initiatives. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Offsets are an increasingly popular tool in the aviation industry:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Citi projects the cost of carbon offsetting for economy flights will reach $3.8 billion over the next five years. It estimated corporate travel will cost $2.4 billion more.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At least </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/nov/19/can-carbon-offsets-tackle-airlines-emissions-problem?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10 other airlines</a></span><span> offer carbon offsetting to passengers, per the Guardian. British Airways will offset carbon from domestic flights in 2020. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>environmental activists downplayed EasyJet’s plan, calling it a “jumbo-size greenwash.” It could be. For EasyJet and other airlines hoping to become more environmentally friendly, offsets obscure the bigger problem: There currently aren’t any ways to engineer planes to emit less carbon in the first place. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead x2...</strong>if you don’t think flygskam will be on the Friday Quiz you’re fooling yourself.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/retail-stocks-drop?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Live Look at Retail Stocks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="GIF of mattresses falling like dominos " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=412 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/tS6yrO1Eo88Te/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="GIF of mattresses falling like dominos " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/tS6yrO1Eo88Te/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, shares in retail companies dropped more than Nelson Agholor—not exactly the confidence booster the industry wanted heading into the holidays.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Kohl’s </strong>stock fell as much as 18% after it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/19/kohls-kss-reports-q3-2019-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missed Q3 earnings</a> and slashed its fiscal 2019 profit outlook. CEO Michelle Gass blamed a race to the bottom for promotions and warmer weather in September.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Home Depot </strong>is struggling to sell 3,000 square feet of drywall online. After <a href="https://apnews.com/fee78c6b1bf451c69e44e4690723f4fc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missing</a> comparable sales numbers for the quarter and admitting its digital overhaul is taking longer than expected, shares dropped more than 5%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Macy’s </strong>stock dropped more than 10%...and it didn’t even report earnings. It did <a href="https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/macys-customer-payment-info-stolen-in-magecart-data-breach/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disclose</a> a data breach that affected a small number of customers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">TJX, </strong>the parent company of TJ Maxx and HomeGoods, was the exception. Shares <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/retailers-give-mixed-read-on-consumer-spending-11574173235?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbed</a> after it raised its profit forecast for the year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>It’s going to be a nervy holiday season for retailers. Not only do they have tariffs to worry about, but the late Thanksgiving means there are only <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/2019/11/13?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">26 days</a> from Black Friday through Christmas Eve.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>+ For more expertly curated retail news, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=retailbrew&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subscribe to Retail Brew</a>. The next edition arrives in just a few hours. </em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/googles-stadia-gaming-service-gets-dinged-critics?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Don’t Have Anything Nice to Say About Stadia...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of Google's Stadia gaming controller" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MjAyMDY1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Google</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, that didn’t stop reviewers from talking about Google’s new cloud-based gaming service. The console-less Stadia needed consolation after its rough launch yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Here’s a four-word review on the Premiere Edition in 2019: It’s not worth it”—</span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/video-games/reviews/unplayable-times-magical-others-stadias-dream-is-still-clouds/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WaPo’s Gene Park</a></span><span>. Park acknowledged Stadia is likely to improve...but users should wait until that happens.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“It’s effectively a beta that Google is charging real money for”—The Verge’s </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/18/20970297/google-stadia-review-gaming-streaming-cloud-price-specs-features-chrome-pixel?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sean Hollister</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Google Stadia wants you to replace your video game console. Don’t.”—NYT’s </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/18/technology/personaltech/google-stadia-review.html?rref=collection%2Fbyline%2Fbrian-x.-chen&action=click&contentCollection=undefined&region=stream&module=stream_unit&version=latest&contentPlacement=1&pgtype=collection&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brian Chen</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Early reviewers said that even with strong internet connections, performance was inconsistent across devices. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gamers used to high-quality performance on Xbox or PlayStation consoles may be reluctant to move to Stadia, especially given a $130 initial price tag that doesn't cover premium games or 4K streaming. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The gaming industry <a href="https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2019/11/google-stadia-might-be-gamings-future-but-in-the-present-it-looks-rough/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">may be moving to streaming</a>, but Stadia isn't likely to sway gamers used to their consoles and/or PCs. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/spotify-launches-personalized-pod-playlists?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Call It Spodify
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's the quickest way to get people to leave your house party? Blast “Your Daily Podcasts,” a new playlist from Spotify that curates audio content based on your podcast listening history.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spotify’s algorithms will <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/19/20971061/spotify-playlist-daily-podcast-update-recommendations-subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggest</a> episodes from shows users already listen to and new ones they might enjoy. The company said it won’t prioritize its original podcasts, like Bill Simmons's <em>The Hottest Take</em>, over others. The feature is available to users in the U.S., Canada, Australia, Brazil, the U.K., and a few other countries. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Swedish company’s spent 2019 ramping up its pod game to challenge Apple. That’s included <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/07/spotify-bets-big-podcasts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquiring</a> three podcasting companies (Gimlet and Anchor for close to $340 million; Parcast for $56 million) and <a href="https://www.digitaltrends.com/home-theater/spotify-podcast-playlist-to-help-listeners-discover-new-shows/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testing</a> curated pod playlists this June.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Something’s working. </strong>In Q3, Spotify <a href="https://s22.q4cdn.com/540910603/files/doc_financials/2019/q3/Shareholder-Letter-Q3-2019-[Final].pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a>: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>39% quarter-over-quarter growth in podcast hours streamed </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Almost too good to be true” conversion of podcast listeners to paying subscribers (it’s got 113 million of those now)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>500,000+ podcast titles, including the launch of 22 Spotify Studios originals</span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F19%2Fspotify-launches-personalized-pod-playlists" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+quickest+way+to+get+people+to+leave+your+house+party&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/spotify-launches-personalized-pod-playlists&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F19%2Fspotify-launches-personalized-pod-playlists&title=Spotify+Launches+Personalized+Pod+Playlists+&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=The+quickest+way+to+get+people+to+leave+your+house+party" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dear reader,</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I found my <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277920191120" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> password. With it, I found myself.</p>

You name it, and <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277920191120" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> integrates it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are tears in my eyes as I type to you, writing of <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277920191120" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>’s <strong style="color:#000">automation tools</strong> that allow you to use an event inside <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277920191120" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> to automatically trigger another action in <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277920191120" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/bill-gatesbacked-startup-announces-big-breakthrough?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Heliogen Makes Cement Manufacturing Fun
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="heliogen " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODEwL2hlbGlvZ2VuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Heliogen</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If by “fun” you mean “sustainable,” which we do. Heliogen, a startup backed by Bill Gates, has come out of stealth to announce it's <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90431869/this-bill-gates-backed-solar-tech-could-help-finally-decarbonize-heavy-industry?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">successfully concentrated</a> solar energy past a balmy 1,000° Celsius for the first time commercially. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that has to do with cement: </strong>The industrial processes that make cement, steel, and glass require extreme temperatures that renewable energy hasn’t yet been able to muster. Fossil fuels like coal have picked up the slack.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How Heliogen cracked it: </strong>Using the same tech that brought down Snow White’s Evil Queen. Heliogen <a href="https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20191119005374/en/Heliogen-Achieves-Breakthrough-Temperatures-Concentrated-Sunlight-Industrial?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> it controls an array of mirrors using advanced computer vision software. Those mirrors create a concentrated solar beam that generates the heat required to power industrial processes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Heliogen said its tech could even be used to generate loads of clean hydrogen, which could </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/18/hydrogen-is-the-energy-future?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">change</a></span><span> the energy game. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Industrial processes are responsible for <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/19/heliogens-new-technology-could-unlock-renewable-energy-for-industrial-manufacturing/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over a fifth</a> of all carbon emissions, per Gates. If Heliogen can pave the way for renewables in the sector, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/nov/19/bill-gates-energy-startup-sunlight-heliogen-solar-energy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it could help</a> the world reach the targets set by the Paris agreement.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Time’s Person of the Year poll has <a href="https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-media-trends-a189a865-c7ed-4a0a-86ca-7182692eb74f.html?chunk=7#story7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gone viral</a>, making us wonder...who would win Morning Brew’s Person of the Year? Tell us the individual, group, or other sentient being(s) that should take the 2019 title <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1196922376535126017?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday morning quarterback:</strong> See if you can find the grammar or stylistic errors in these sentences about football from the<span> </span><a href="https://blogs.wsj.com/styleandsubstance/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ editors</a>. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Adults who report following the NFL closely has dropped 9% since 2014, the poll finds.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The most telling drop-off: Wentz averaged 8.3 yards per attempt this season; Foles has averaged more than 2 yards fewer.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Long a staple of football or soccer practice, coaches for other sports are adding reverse, or retro, racing to training regimes.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The NBA has shown it’s possible to run a large-scale professional operation—and grow a fan base—by putting trust in athletes, as opposed to policing them with draconian policies.</span></li>
</ol>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOR THE GRAM ANSWERS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some subject/verb agreement problems in this one (the adults didn’t drop). This can be written through as “The category of adults who…”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Back to the fewer vs. less distinction. Use fewer for whole, countable units; since yards (and other units of measurement) aren’t experienced as whole chunks, this should be “less.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the context of this sentence, coaches should not be the staple of football and soccer practice. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This was a hard one. The WSJ editors note that the use of “grow” as a transitive verb, applied to things like the economy or a fan base, is rather cliche. They recommend using “enlarge” or “expand” instead. </span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAVIATION\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nEasyJet Offers a Mini Green New Deal\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"green plane \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTk4MjM5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEasyJet, a British budget airline, said yesterday it will immediately start \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/nov/19/easyjet-offset-carbon-emissions-flights-thomas-cook-collapse?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoffsetting\u003c/a\u003e fuel emissions from its routes, becoming the world’s first major airline to operate net-zero carbon flights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe aviation industry is confronting its impact on climate change—not because the last book club pick was Naomi Klein, but because some travelers are opting for literal torture (\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-49890057?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e24-hour train rides\u003c/a\u003e) over flying.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose people have been overcome with \u003cem\u003eflygskam\u003c/em\u003e, a Swedish term that means “flight shame.” Citi \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/citi-flight-shaming-getting-traction-could-cost-airlines-billions.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edefines\u003c/a\u003e flight shame as “the inherent guilt that an individual feels as a result of one’s aviation-related carbon footprint.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFlygskam is a widespread condition. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA UBS survey of Western travelers found that 21% of respondents reduced the number of flights they took in the last year out of concern for the climate. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAviation \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/8646ab32-c289-11e9-a8e9-296ca66511c9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtributes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e close to 5% of human-caused warming, reports the FT.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut will offsets help flygskam be flygsgone? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBravo on that transition to the growing market for carbon offsets, a process by which polluters (like EasyJet) fund projects that reduce carbon emissions to “offset” their own. Those projects can include planting a whole lot of trees or spearheading renewable energy initiatives. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOffsets are an increasingly popular tool in the aviation industry:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCiti projects the cost of carbon offsetting for economy flights will reach $3.8 billion over the next five years. It estimated corporate travel will cost $2.4 billion more.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt least \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/nov/19/can-carbon-offsets-tackle-airlines-emissions-problem?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10 other airlines\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e offer carbon offsetting to passengers, per the Guardian. British Airways will offset carbon from domestic flights in 2020. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eenvironmental activists downplayed EasyJet’s plan, calling it a “jumbo-size greenwash.” It could be. For EasyJet and other airlines hoping to become more environmentally friendly, offsets obscure the bigger problem: There currently aren’t any ways to engineer planes to emit less carbon in the first place. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead x2...\u003c/strong\u003eif you don’t think flygskam will be on the Friday Quiz you’re fooling yourself.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, shares in retail companies dropped more than Nelson Agholor—not exactly the confidence booster the industry wanted heading into the holidays.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKohl’s \u003c/strong\u003estock fell as much as 18% after it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/19/kohls-kss-reports-q3-2019-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emissed Q3 earnings\u003c/a\u003e and slashed its fiscal 2019 profit outlook. CEO Michelle Gass blamed a race to the bottom for promotions and warmer weather in September.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHome Depot \u003c/strong\u003eis struggling to sell 3,000 square feet of drywall online. After \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/fee78c6b1bf451c69e44e4690723f4fc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emissing\u003c/a\u003e comparable sales numbers for the quarter and admitting its digital overhaul is taking longer than expected, shares dropped more than 5%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMacy’s \u003c/strong\u003estock dropped more than 10%...and it didn’t even report earnings. It did \u003ca href=\"https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/macys-customer-payment-info-stolen-in-magecart-data-breach/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisclose\u003c/a\u003e a data breach that affected a small number of customers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTJX, \u003c/strong\u003ethe parent company of TJ Maxx and HomeGoods, was the exception. Shares \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/retailers-give-mixed-read-on-consumer-spending-11574173235?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclimbed\u003c/a\u003e after it raised its profit forecast for the year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s going to be a nervy holiday season for retailers. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, that didn’t stop reviewers from talking about Google’s new cloud-based gaming service. The console-less Stadia needed consolation after its rough launch yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“Here’s a four-word review on the Premiere Edition in 2019: It’s not worth it”—\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/video-games/reviews/unplayable-times-magical-others-stadias-dream-is-still-clouds/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWaPo’s Gene Park\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Park acknowledged Stadia is likely to improve...but users should wait until that happens.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“It’s effectively a beta that Google is charging real money for”—The Verge’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/18/20970297/google-stadia-review-gaming-streaming-cloud-price-specs-features-chrome-pixel?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSean Hollister\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“Google Stadia wants you to replace your video game console. Don’t.”—NYT’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/18/technology/personaltech/google-stadia-review.html?rref=collection%2Fbyline%2Fbrian-x.-chen\u0026action=click\u0026contentCollection=undefined\u0026region=stream\u0026module=stream_unit\u0026version=latest\u0026contentPlacement=1\u0026pgtype=collection\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBrian Chen\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarly reviewers said that even with strong internet connections, performance was inconsistent across devices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGamers used to high-quality performance on Xbox or PlayStation consoles may be reluctant to move to Stadia, especially given a $130 initial price tag that doesn't cover premium games or 4K streaming. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe gaming industry \u003ca href=\"https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2019/11/google-stadia-might-be-gamings-future-but-in-the-present-it-looks-rough/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emay be moving to streaming\u003c/a\u003e, but Stadia isn't likely to sway gamers used to their consoles and/or style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat's the quickest way to get people to leave your house party? Blast “Your Daily Podcasts,” a new playlist from Spotify that curates audio content based on your podcast listening history.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpotify’s algorithms will \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/19/20971061/spotify-playlist-daily-podcast-update-recommendations-subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggest\u003c/a\u003e episodes from shows users already listen to and new ones they might enjoy. The company said it won’t prioritize its original podcasts, like Bill Simmons's \u003cem\u003eThe Hottest Take\u003c/em\u003e, over others. The feature is available to users in the U.S., Canada, Australia, Brazil, the U.K., and a few other countries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Swedish company’s spent 2019 ramping up its pod game to challenge Apple. That’s included \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/07/spotify-bets-big-podcasts?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquiring\u003c/a\u003e three podcasting companies (Gimlet and Anchor for close to $340 million; Parcast for $56 million) and \u003ca href=\"https://www.digitaltrends.com/home-theater/spotify-podcast-playlist-to-help-listeners-discover-new-shows/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etesting\u003c/a\u003e curated pod playlists this June.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSomething’s working. \u003c/strong\u003eIn Q3, Spotify \u003ca href=\"https://s22.q4cdn.com/540910603/files/doc_financials/2019/q3/Shareholder-Letter-Q3-2019-[Final].pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Almost too good to be true” conversion of podcast listeners to paying subscribers (it’s got 113 million of those style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf by “fun” you mean “sustainable,” which we do. Heliogen, a startup backed by Bill Gates, has come out of stealth to announce it's \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90431869/this-bill-gates-backed-solar-tech-could-help-finally-decarbonize-heavy-industry?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuccessfully concentrated\u003c/a\u003e solar energy past a balmy 1,000° Celsius for the first time commercially. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that has to do with cement: \u003c/strong\u003eThe industrial processes that make cement, steel, and glass require extreme temperatures that renewable energy hasn’t yet been able to muster. Fossil fuels like coal have picked up the slack.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow Heliogen cracked it: \u003c/strong\u003eUsing the same tech that brought down Snow White’s Evil Queen. Heliogen \u003ca href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20191119005374/en/Heliogen-Achieves-Breakthrough-Temperatures-Concentrated-Sunlight-Industrial?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e it controls an array of mirrors using advanced computer vision software. Those mirrors create a concentrated solar beam that generates the heat required to power industrial processes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHeliogen said its tech could even be used to generate loads of clean hydrogen, which could \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/18/hydrogen-is-the-energy-future?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echange\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the energy game. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIndustrial processes are responsible for \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/19/heliogens-new-technology-could-unlock-renewable-energy-for-industrial-manufacturing/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover a fifth\u003c/a\u003e of all carbon emissions, per Gates. If Heliogen can pave the way for renewables in the sector, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/nov/19/bill-gates-energy-startup-sunlight-heliogen-solar-energy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit could help\u003c/a\u003e the world reach the targets set by the Paris agreement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F19%2Fbill-gatesbacked-startup-announces-big-breakthrough\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
